text: Multiple people at state wrestling tournament diagnosed with measles as it spreads in Utah - KSL News
fullText: Utah health officials say cases of measles are spreading to new areas in Utah, particularly in schools and at extracurricular events like a recent state wrestling tournament.

text: Give Punch a break! Zoo responds to heartbreaking video of baby monkey - USA Today
fullText: In a new video of Punch, the baby monkey is dragged around in circles by an adult monkey, upsetting animal lovers around the globe. The zoo explains.

text: Trump pledges $10 billion for Board of Peace in inaugural meeting on Gaza - Axios
Why does women's pain last longer than men's? A new study offers an answer - NBC News
fullText: Women are more likely to experience chronic pain, studies have found, and their pain lasts longer, on average. New research suggests it's because of immune system differences.

text: See where snow could be measured in inches — or feet — in the East this weekend - The Washington Post
fullText: A strong nor’easter is expected to form near the Mid-Atlantic coast on Sunday, threatening to bring accumulating snow, strong winds and travel disruptions.

text: Veteran almost fails to make weight again for UFC Houston - MMA Fighting
fullText: Sean Strickland and Anthony Hernandez made weight for UFC Houston, and one veteran nearly registered a third weight miss.

text: OpenAI’s first Jony Ive device sounds like HomePod 2.0: report - 9to5Mac

text: Trump adviser drops bombshell on Meta, Microsoft - thestreet.com

text: House Speaker Johnson rejects request for Jesse Jackson to lie in honor at Capitol - CNN
fullText: House Speaker Mike Johnson has denied a request for the late Rev. Jesse Jackson Sr. to lie in honor at the United States Capitol, citing past precedent over how the deaths of other high-profile figures were handled, according to sources familiar with the matt…

text: Top-ranked Canada, U.S. fall in women's Olympic curling semis - ESPN
fullText: Canada's top-ranked women were upset by Sweden in the Olympic curling semifinals, while the United States also suffered a 7-4 loss to Switzerland.

text: Gennaro Filice 2026 NFL mock draft 1.0: Jeremiyah Love cracks top five; Chiefs take WR Jordyn Tyson - NFL.com
fullText: In his first mock of the 2026 NFL Draft, Gennaro Filice defies "positional value," predicting a running back, linebacker and safety come off the board in the top 10. Check out his full first-round projection, 1-32.

text: Nintendo turned its biggest flop into an expensive, uncomfortable novelty - The Verge
fullText: Nintendo’s new Virtual Boy accessory for the Switch and Switch 2 is much like the original: an interesting, awkward, and uncomfortable novelty.

text: Ali Akbar, who's sold newspapers on the streets of Paris for 50 years, is now a knight - NPR
fullText: For decades, Ali Akbar has sold papers on the Left Bank of Paris. Last month, France gave the beloved 73-year-old immigrant from Pakistan one of its highest honors — and his neighborhood is cheering.

text: Oddest moments from India’s AI summit: Missing stars, traffic chaos and robo-dog controversy - politico.eu
fullText: A lot of important topics were debated in New Delhi, but there was also some fun and frustration.

text: Under Mamdani, City to Probe Businesses Where Most Workers Take Zero Sick Days - THE CITY - NYC News
fullText: Employers will be subject to an investigation by the Department of Consumer and Worker Protection if more than half their employees took zero paid time off in a given year.

text: Israeli settlers kill 19-year-old Palestinian American, officials and witnesses say - NPR
fullText: Israeli settlers in the occupied West Bank shot and killed a Palestinian American man during an attack on a village, the Palestinian Health Ministry said.

text: A Mystery Phone, Found in the Desert, Slowly Reveals Its Secrets - CNET
fullText: Exclusive: The Samsung phone had been lost for a decade. Then Katie Elkin found it.

text: Hubble telescope discovers rare galaxy that is 99% dark matter - Space
fullText: "This is the first galaxy detected solely through its globular cluster population."
